iExecuteCreate.!description: Executes the Create action on the create dialog.

iCheckQuickFilter.!description: Checks the quick filter action of the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the control

iCheckCreationRow.!description: Checks the state of the CreationRow button in the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the target row

iCheckQuickFilterItems.!description: Checks the number of items in the quick-filter menu.

parameters.iExpectedNumberOfItems: type: number, description: The expected number of quick-filter items

iCheckAction.!description: Checks the state of a table action.
iCheckAction.!type: fn(vActionIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of the action, or its label
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckFullScreen.!description: Checks the Fullscreen action of the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckRows.!description: Checks the rows of a table. If mRowValues is provided, only rows with the corresponding values are considered. If iNumberOfRows is provided, the number of rows are checked with respect to the provided mRowValues (if set) or in total. If iNumberOfRows is omitted, it checks for at least one matching row. If mState is provided, the row must be in the given state.
iCheckRows.!type: fn(mRowValues?: Object, iExpectedNumberOfRows?: Number, mState?: Object, vHiddenCells?: Array) -> Object

parameters.iExpectedNumberOfRows: type: number, description: The expected number of rows considering mRowValues and mRowState
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the target row
parameters.vHiddenCells: type: Array, description: Defines the cells of the identified rows which are expected to the hidden (visible=false). You can also use test function iCheckCells to explicitly check a specific cell of a row.

iCheckDelete.!description: Checks the Delete action of the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckMenuAction.!description: Checks an action in the drop-down menu that is currently open.

parameters.vAction: type: object|string, description: The label of the action, or its state

iCheckColumnAdaptation.!description: Checks whether the adaptation button is available for the table.

iCheckColumnSorting.!description: Checks whether the sort button is available for the table.

iSeeFocusOnRow.!description: Checks if the focus is on a table row.

parameters.iRowIndex: type: number, description: The expected focused row

iCheckAdaptationColumn.!description: Checks a field in the adaptation dialog.
iCheckAdaptationColumn.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column, or its label
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the field control in the adaptation dialog

iCheckExport.!description: Checks whether the export button is available for the table.

iCheckCells.!description: Checks the state of the cells of a table. This function can only be used for simple content within a table cell. Checking complex content like combined fields within a cell is not supported.
iCheckCells.!type: fn(vRowValues?: Object | Number, mColumnStateMap: Object) -> Object

iCheckSearchField.!description: Checks the search field in the table toolbar. If the sSearchText parameter is undefined, the search text is not validated.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the search field
parameters.sSearchText: type: string, description: The expected text in the search field

iCheckCreate.!description: Checks the Create action of the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iSeeFocusOnHeader.!description: Checks if the focus is on a table.

iCheckFilterField.!description: Checks, if a filter field is available in the filter dialog.
iCheckFilterField.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the field, or its label
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the field control in the filter dialog

iCheckState.!description: Checks the state of the table.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the table

iCheckSortOrder.!description: Checks a field in the sorting dialog.
iCheckSortOrder.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, sSortOrder?: sap.ui.core.SortOrder, bCheckPersonalization?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.bCheckPersonalization: type: boolean, description: Defines if the order is checked via sorting dialog, or via the column itself
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column, or its label
parameters.sSortOrder: type: sap.ui.core.SortOrder, description: The sort order of the column, default is {@link sap.ui.core.SortOrder.Ascending}

iCheckPaste.!description: Checks whether the paste button is available for the table.

iCheckColumnAdaptationDialog.!description: Checks whether the column adaptation dialog is open.

iCheckMessageStrip.!description: Checks a messageStrip on a table.

parameters.mProperty: type: object, description: Defines the expected properties of the messageStrip in the table

iCheckColumnFiltering.!description: Checks whether the filter button is available for the table.

iCheckColumns.!description: Checks the state of the columns of the table.

parameters.iExpectedNumberOfColumns: type: number, description: The expected number of columns

iExecuteAction.!description: Executes an action in the header toolbar of a list report.

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of the action

parameters.sBookmarkTitle: type: string, description: The title of the new tile

sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner.!description: A JourneyRunner for executing integration tests with given settings.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner.

run.!description:
Static function to run the default runner with given parameters. Shortcut for 
JourneyRunner.getDefaultRunner().run(mSettings, Journey1, Journey2, ...)
See {@link sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner#run} for parameter details.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.base.Object.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getBaseAssertions.!description: Returns the base assertions instance to be used for {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#sap.ui.test.Opa5.extendConfig} assertions setting. This function is only used if assertions is not defined via the runner settings. It is meant to be overridden by a custom JourneyRunner implementation to provide custom base assertions. By default, an instance of {@link sap.fe.test.BaseAssertions} will be returned.

getBaseActions.!description: Returns the base action instance to be used for {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#sap.ui.test.Opa5.extendConfig} actions setting. This function is only used if actions is not defined via the runner settings. It is meant to be overridden by a custom JourneyRunner implementation to provide custom base actions. By default, an instance of {@link sap.fe.test.BaseActions} will be returned.

sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner.!helpDescription: A JourneyRunner for executing integration tests with given settings.

getBaseArrangements.!description: Returns the base arrangements instance to be used for {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5#sap.ui.test.Opa5.extendConfig} arrangements setting. This function is only used if arrangements is not defined via the runner settings. It is meant to be overridden by a custom JourneyRunner implementation to provide custom base assertions. By default, an instance of {@link sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements} will be returned.

parameters.mSettings: type: object, description: The settings object of the runner instance

setDefaultRunner.!description: Sets the global journey runner instance.

parameters.oDefaultRunner: type: sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner, description: Defines the global default {@link sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner} instance

getDefaultRunner.!description: Gets the global journey runner instance.

iCheckState.!description: Checks the state of the footer bar.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the footer bar

iCheckAction.!description: Checks the state of an action in the footer bar.
iCheckAction.!type: fn(vActionIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of an action
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

parameters.iConditionIndex: type: number, description: The index of the condition to be removed. If not set, the index 0 is used

iChangeFilterField.!description: Changes the value of a filter field.
iChangeFilterField.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, vValue?: String, bClearFirst?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the filter field
parameters.vValue: type: string, description: The new target value.
parameters.bClearFirst: type: boolean, description: Set to true to clear previously set filters, otherwise all previously set values will be kept

iChangeCondition.!type: fn(sOperator: String, vValues: [String | String], iConditionIndex?: Number) -> Object

parameters.vValues: type: string|string[], description: The values to be set. If the operator requires more than one value like BT (between) an array with the two entries is expected
parameters.iConditionIndex: type: number, description: The index of the condition to be altered. If not set, the index 0 is used
parameters.sOperator: type: string, description: The condition operator, like EQ, BT, LT, GT (see also {@link sap.ui.model.filter.FilterOperator})

iChangeSearchField.!description: Changes the value of the search field.

parameters.sSearchText: type: string, description: The new search value.

iSelectRows.!type: fn(vRowValues?: Object | Number, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the row

parameters.vValues: type: string|string[], description: The values to be set. If the operator requires more than one value, like BT (between), an array with the two entries is expected
parameters.sOperator: type: string, description: The condition operator, like EQ, BT, LT, GT (see also {@link sap.ui.model.filter.FilterOperator})

iGoToSearchAndSelect.!description: Navigates to the Search and Select tab.

sap.fe.test.BaseAssertions.!description: All common assertions (Then) for all Opa tests are defined here.

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.fe.test.BaseAssertions with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

iSeeIllustratedMessage.!description: Checks whether a {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage} with given message is shown.

parameters.sMessage: type: string, description: The message shown on the page

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.fe.test.BaseAssertions.

sap.fe.test.BaseAssertions.!helpDescription: All common assertions (Then) for all Opa tests are defined here.

iSeeMessageToast.!description: Checks whether a {@link sap.m.MessageToast} with the given text is shown.

parameters.sText: type: string, description: The text shown in the MessageToast

iSeePage.!description: Checks whether a {@link sap.m.Page} is shown.

iSeeMessagePage.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.118 use iSeePage() && iSeeIllustratedMessage(sMessage) instead
Checks whether a {@link sap.m.MessagePage} with given message is shown.

parameters.sMessage: type: string, description: The message shown on the message page

columnSorting.!description: Helper method to sort columns fields. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open sorting dialog. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the columns, and closed/confirmed directly afterwards.
columnSorting.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object, vActions?: fn() | Array | sap.ui.test.actions.Action, sDescription: String) -> Object

parameters.vActions: type: function|Array|sap.ui.test.actions.Action, description: The actions to be executed on found adaptation field
parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: The description of the check or adaptation
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the state of the adaptation column

iOpenColumnAdaptation.!description: Opens the column adaptation dialog of the table.

selectColumnOnFilterDialog.!description: Helper method to personalize table, to select a columns from the combo box on the filter dialog.

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier provided

iOpenColumnSorting.!description: Opens the sorting dialog of the table.

iOpenFilterDialog.!description: Opens the filtering dialog of the table.

iConfirmFilterDialog.!description: Confirms and closes the filtering dialog of the table.

iConfirmColumnSorting.!description: Confirms and closes the sorting dialog of the table.

personalization.!description: Helper method to personalize table, either adapt columns or filter. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open dialog. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the columns, and closed/confirmed directly afterwards.
personalization.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object, vActions?: fn() | Array | sap.ui.test.actions.Action, sDescription: String, oDialogBuilder: sap.ui.test.OpaBuilder, fnOpenDialog: fn(), fnCloseDialog: fn()) -> Object

parameters.fnOpenDialog: type: function, description: A callback for opening the dialog
parameters.vActions: type: function|Array|sap.ui.test.actions.Action, description: The actions to be executed on found field
parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: The description of the check or adaptation
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The field identifier
parameters.oDialogBuilder: type: sap.ui.test.OpaBuilder, description: The dialog builder
parameters.fnCloseDialog: type: function, description: A callback for closing the dialog

iConfirmColumnAdaptation.!description: Confirms and closes the adaptation dialog of the table.

sortingPersonalization.!description: Helper method to adapt the sorting of a table. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open dialog. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the columns, and closed/confirmed directly afterwards.
sortingPersonalization.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object, vActions?: fn() | Array | sap.ui.test.actions.Action, sDescription: String, oDialogBuilder: sap.ui.test.OpaBuilder, fnOpenDialog: fn(), fnCloseDialog: fn()) -> Object

parameters.fnOpenDialog: type: function, description: A callback for opening the dialog
parameters.vActions: type: function|Array|sap.ui.test.actions.Action, description: The actions to be executed on found field
parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: The description of the check or adaptation
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The field identifier
parameters.oDialogBuilder: type: sap.ui.test.OpaBuilder, description: The dialog builder
parameters.fnCloseDialog: type: function, description: A callback for closing the dialog

columnAdaptation.!description: Helper method to adapt columns fields. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open adaptation dialog. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the columns, and closed/confirmed directly afterwards.
columnAdaptation.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, mState?: Object, vActions?: fn() | Array | sap.ui.test.actions.Action, sDescription: String) -> Object

parameters.vActions: type: function|Array|sap.ui.test.actions.Action, description: The actions to be executed on found adaptation field
parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: The description of the check or adaptation
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the state of the adaptation column

filterFieldAdaptation.!description: Helper method to adapt filter fields. If no actions are given, this function can be used for checking only. During execution it checks for an already open adaptation popover. If it does not exist, it is opened before the check/interaction of the filter fields, and closed directly afterwards.
filterFieldAdaptation.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, mState?: Object, vActions?: fn() | Array | sap.ui.test.actions.Action, sDescription: String) -> Object

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the field
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the adaptation filter field

iOpenFilterAdaptation.!description: Opens the filter bar adaptation. It can be used in an action chain as well as in an assertion chain.

iConfirmFilterAdaptation.!description: Confirms the filter bar adaptation. It can be used in an action chain as well as in an assertion chain.

createFilterFieldBuilder.!description: Retrieve a filter field by its identifier.

parameters.mState: type: any, description: undefined

iChangeDialogField.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: sap.fe.test.api.DialogFieldIdentifier, vValue?: String, bClearFirst?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: sap.fe.test.api.DialogFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the field
parameters.vValue: type: string, description: The new target value.
parameters.bClearFirst: type: boolean, description: Set to true to clear previously set filters, otherwise all previously set values will be kept

iClose.!description: Closes the dialog by pressing the 'Escape' key.

iConfirm.!description: Confirms the dialog by clicking the corresponding button (for example, 'OK').

iChangeActionParameterDialogField.!description:
Changes the content of a field in an action parameter dialog.

Deprecated: Please use dialog action iChangeDialogField.
iChangeActionParameterDialogField.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: sap.fe.test.api.ActionDialogFieldIdentifier, vValue?: String, bClearFirst?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: sap.fe.test.api.ActionDialogFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the field
parameters.vValue: type: string, description: The new target value.
parameters.bClearFirst: type: boolean, description: Set to true to clear previously set filters, otherwise all previously set values will be kept

iCancel.!description: Cancels the dialog by clicking the corresponding button (for example, 'Cancel').

iExecuteKeyboardShortcut.!description: Executes a keyboard shortcut on dialog.

parameters.sShortcut: type: string, description: The shortcut pattern

sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements.!description: All common arrangements (Given) for all Opa tests are defined here.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements.

iStartMyApp.!description: Starts the app in an IFrame, using the launchUrl and launchParameters provided via the settings object of the {@link sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements#constructor}.

parameters.sAppHash: type: string, description: The app hash
parameters.mInUrlParameters: type: object, description: A map with additional URL parameters

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.test.Opa5.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

iRestartMyApp.!description: Simulates a refresh of the page by tearing it down and then restarting it with the very same hash.

resetTestData.!description:
Clears the browser's local storage and session storage.

NOTE: The function itself is not meant to be called directly within a journey. Instead, it can be overwritten to add custom clean-up functionality when calling {@link sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements#iResetTestData}.

sap.fe.test.BaseArrangements.!helpDescription: All common arrangements (Given) for all Opa tests are defined here.

iExecuteApply.!description: Executes the Apply action in the footer bar of a sub-object page.

iExecuteCancel.!description: Executes the Cancel action in the footer bar of the object page.

iExecuteSave.!description: Executes the Save or Create action in the footer bar of the object page.

iConfirmCancel.!description: Confirms the Cancel action when user clicks Cancel in draft mode.

iSelectAllRows.!description: Selects all rows in a table.

iExecuteDelete.!description: Executes the Delete action on the table.

iCollapseGroupRow.!description: Collapses a row corresponding to a visual group.

parameters.iLevel: type: number, description: The level of the group row to be collapsed (1-based)
parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: The title of the group row to be collapsed

iExecuteAction.!description: Executes an action on the table.

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of the action, or its label

iExecuteShowHideDetails.!description: Executes the Show/Hide details action on the table.

parameters.bShowDetails: type: boolean, description: Optional parameter to enforce a certain state (showing details yes/no corresponds to true/false); if not set, state is toggled

iRemoveVariant.!description: Removes the variant of the given name.

parameters.sVariantName: type: string, description: The name of the variant to be removed

iExecuteKeyboardShortcut.!description: Executes a keyboard shortcut on the table or a cell control. If only sShortcut is defined, the shortcut is executed on the table directly. If additionally vRowValues and vColumn are defined, the shortcut is executed on table cell level.
iExecuteKeyboardShortcut.!type: fn(sShortcut: String, vRowValues?: Object | Number, vColumn: String | Number) -> Object

parameters.sShortcut: type: string, description: The shortcut pattern
parameters.vColumn: type: string|number, description: The column name, label or index

iExecuteInlineCreate.!description: Executes the action to create a row in the table.

iSaveVariant.!description: Saves a variant under the given name, or overwrites the current one.

parameters.sVariantName: type: string, description: The name of the new variant. If omitted, the current variant will be overwritten

iAggregateByColumn.!description: Aggregates the table entries by the specified column.
iAggregateByColumn.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier | Number, sFieldLabel?: String) -> Object

parameters.sFieldLabel: type: string, description: The target field to group on. If undefined, parameter vColumnIdentifier is used as label to identify the toggle button.
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier|number, description: The identifier of the column field, its label or index

parameters.sSearchText: type: string, description: The new search text

iPressCell.!description: Presses the control in the table cell.
iPressCell.!type: fn(mRowValues?: Object, vColumn: String | Number) -> Object

parameters.vColumn: type: string|number, description: The column name, label or index

parameters.sVariantName: type: string, description: The name of the variant to be selected

iSelectRows.!type: fn(vRowValues?: Object | Number, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the row

parameters.aData: type: string[][], description: The data to be pasted

iRemoveAdaptationColumn.!description: Removes a field as a column from the table.

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column field, or its label

iGroupByColumn.!description: Groups the table entries by the specified column.
iGroupByColumn.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier | Number, sFieldLabel?: String) -> Object

parameters.sFieldLabel: type: string, description: The target field for grouping. If undefined, parameter vColumnIdentifier is used as label to identify the toggle button.
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier|number, description: The identifier of the column field, its label or index

iOpenValueHelpOfFilterField.!description: Opens the value help of a filter field on the filter dialog.

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column

iPressMore.!description: Scrolls update the grow threshold of responsive table and rebind the table.

iExecuteInlineAction.!description: Executes an action that is available in a certain column within a table row.
iExecuteInlineAction.!type: fn(vRowValues?: Object | Number, vColumn: String | Number) -> Object

parameters.vColumn: type: string|number, description: The column name, label or index

iSetDefaultVariant.!description: Sets the variant as the default.

parameters.sVariantName: type: string, description: The name of the variant to be set as the default variant. If omitted, the Standard variant is set as the default

iAddAdaptationColumn.!description: Adds a field as a column to the table.

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column field, or its label

iChangeFilterField.!description: Adds a filter condition to the filter field.
iChangeFilterField.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, vValue: String | Object, bClearFirst?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column
parameters.vValue: type: string|object, description: Defines the value of the filter field condition
parameters.bClearFirst: type: boolean, description: Set to true to clear previously set filters, otherwise all previously set values will be kept

iSortByColumn.!description: Sorts the table entries by the specified column.
iSortByColumn.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier | Number, sFieldLabel?: String, bDescending?: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.sFieldLabel: type: string, description: The target field for sorting in case the field label differs from the column label or in case of a complex property
parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier|number, description: The identifier of the column field, its label or index

iChangeRow.!description: Changes the specified row. The given value map must match exactly one row. If only one parameter is provided, it must be the mTargetValues and mRowValues is considered undefined. If vRowValues are not defined, then the targetValues are inserted in the creationRow.
iChangeRow.!type: fn(vRowValues?: Object | Number, mTargetValues: Object, bInputNotFinalized: Boolean) -> Object

parameters.bInputNotFinalized: type: boolean, description: If true, we keep the focus on the modified cell and don't press enter to validate the input
parameters.mTargetValues: type: object, description: A map of columns (either name or index) to its new value. The columns do not need to match the ones defined in vRowValues.

iScroll.!description: Scrolls up/down to the first/last row of the table.

parameters.sDirection: type: string, description: The scroll direction "up" or "down" (default)

iExecuteFullScreen.!description: Executes the Fullscreen action on the table.

iExecuteMenuAction.!description: Executes an action form the drop-down menu that is currently open.

parameters.vAction: type: string|object, description: The label of the action or its state

iClickOnMessageStripFilter.!description: Presses the messageStrip filter in case of issues, warnings or error message on the table.

iExecuteCreate.!description: Executes the Create action on the table.

iChangeSortOrder.!description: Adds a field to the sorting of the table via the sort dialog.
iChangeSortOrder.!type: fn(vColumnIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, sSortOrder?: sap.ui.core.SortOrder) -> Object

parameters.vColumnIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ColumnIdentifier, description: The identifier of the column field, or its label
parameters.sSortOrder: type: sap.ui.core.SortOrder, description: The sort order, default is {@link sap.ui.core.SortOrder.Ascending}

iSelectQuickFilterItem.!description: Selects a quick-filter item on the table.

iExpandGroupRow.!description: Expands a row corresponding to a visual group.

parameters.iLevel: type: number, description: The level of the group row to be expanded (1-based)
parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: The title of the group row to be expanded

sap.fe.test.ObjectPage.!description:
Provides a test page definition for an object page with the corresponding parameters. Sample usage: 
var oObjectPageDefinition = new ObjectPage({ appId: "MyApp", componentId: "MyObjectPageId", entitySet: "MyEntitySet" });
sap.fe.test.ObjectPage.!helpDescription:
Provides a test page definition for an object page with the corresponding parameters. Sample usage: 
var oObjectPageDefinition = new ObjectPage({ appId: "MyApp", componentId: "MyObjectPageId", entitySet: "MyEntitySet" });

iExecuteRefresh.!description: Executes the Refresh action on the message dialog.

iSelectDraftDataLossOption.!description: Selects the specified entry in the draft data loss popup.

iExecuteBack.!description: Executes the Back action on the message dialog.

sap.fe.test.BaseActions.!helpDescription: All common actions (When) for all Opa tests are defined here.

iPressEscape.!description: Simulates the pressing of the Esc key for the element in focus.

iClosePopover.!description:
Closes the open popover via function.

NOTE: This function ensures that a certain UI state is maintained in some exceptional cases. This function isn't usually called directly in a journey.

iCheckView.!description: Checks the view of a Multiple View List Report table.
iCheckView.!type: fn(vViewIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ViewIdentifier, mState: Object) -> Object

onTable.!description: Returns a {@link sap.fe.test.api.TableAssertions} instance for the specified table.

sap.fe.test.Shell.!description: Provides a test page definition for the shell. When using {@link sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner}, this page is made available by default via onTheShell.
sap.fe.test.Shell.!constructorDescription: Constructs a test page definition for the shell.

iNavigateHome.!description: Navigates to the launch pad via the home button.

iOpenNavigationMenu.!description: Opens the navigation menu in the shell header.

parameters.NavigationTitle: type: string, description: The title of the navigation menu to be clicked. If undefined the menu is identified by the internal id only.

sap.fe.test.Shell.!helpDescription: Provides a test page definition for the shell. When using {@link sap.fe.test.JourneyRunner}, this page is made available by default via onTheShell.

iNavigateBack.!description: Navigates back via shell back button.

iCheckIntentBasedNavigation.!description: Check an intent-based navigation. The function checks the semantic object and the action within the URL of an application. Optionally, further URL parameters can be checked.
iCheckIntentBasedNavigation.!type: fn(sSemanticObject: String, sAction: String, aURLParams?: Array) -> Object

parameters.sSemanticObject: type: string, description: The semantic object of the application
parameters.sAction: type: string, description: The action of the application

iNavigateViaMenu.!description: Navigates via a navigation item in the shell's navigation menu.

parameters.sItem: type: string, description: The label of the navigation item

iPressTile.!description: Selecting a tile in the launchpad by its target app, for example iPressTile("SalesOrder-manage").

parameters.sTarget: type: string, description: The target application (hash)

sap.fe.test.TemplatePage.!description: Provides a test page definition for a template page with the corresponding parameters.
sap.fe.test.TemplatePage.!helpDescription: Provides a test page definition for a template page with the corresponding parameters.

iExecuteSearch.!description: Executes the search with the current filters.

parameters.vValue: type: string, description: The new target value
parameters.bClearFirst: type: boolean, description: Set to true to clear previously set filters, otherwise all previously set values will be kept

parameters.vValue: type: string, description: The new value to be selected from the drop-down list

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the filter field

parameters.sShortcut: type: string, description: Pattern for the shortcut
parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the field

parameters.sEditState: type: sap.fe.test.api.EditState, description: Value of an edit state

parameters.bApplyAutomatically: type: string, description: Saves the new variant with option "Apply Automatically".
parameters.bSetAsDefault: type: string, description: Saves the new variant with option "Set as Default".

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

parameters.sDescription: type: string, description: Description of the object page header
parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: Title of the object page header

iCheckAction.!description: Checks an action in the header toolbar.
iCheckAction.!type: fn(vActionIdentifier: String | sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of the action
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button. Checking for visible=false means to check a hidden action.

iCheckEdit.!description: Checks the Edit action in the header toolbar.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button
type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckNumberOfCollaboratingUsers.!description: Checks the number of users collaborating in the draft.

parameters.iExpectedNumber: type: number, description: The expected number of users

iCheckDelete.!description: Checks the Delete action in the header toolbar.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the draft toggle

iCheckMenuAction.!description: Checks an action in the popover that is currently open.

parameters.vAction: type: object|string, description: The state map or label of the action

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckActionHasFocus.!description: Checks if a specific header action is in focus.

parameters.vActionIdentifier: type: string|sap.fe.test.api.ActionIdentifier, description: The identifier of the action

iCheckCollaboratingUser.!description: Checks if a collaborating user is present.

parameters.sInitials: type: string, description: The initials of the user (displayed in the avatar)

iCheckFieldInFieldGroup.!description: Checks a field within a field group in the object page header.
iCheckFieldInFieldGroup.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: sap.fe.test.api.FieldIdentifier | String, vValue?: String | Array | Object, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: sap.fe.test.api.FieldIdentifier|string, description: The identifier of the field
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the field

parameters.sTitle: type: string, description: The title of the data point

parameters.vFacetIdentifier: type: sap.fe.test.api.HeaderFacetIdentifier, description: The Identifier of the header facet
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state
type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckNumberOfHeaderContentItems.!description: Checks the number of items available in the Object Page header.

parameters.iNumberOfItems: type: number, description: The expected number of items
parameters.bIncludeHidden: type: boolean, description: Defines whether non-visible items should be counted

iCheckMicroChart.!description:
Checks a MicroChart shown in the header of an object page.

TODO this function will not be public yet: Its signature doesn't fit the framework.
iCheckMicroChart.!type: fn(vMicroChartIdentifier: Object | String, sUoMLabel: String) -> Object

parameters.sUoMLabel: type: string, description: UoM label of the MicroChart
parameters.vMicroChartIdentifier: type: object|string, description: Id/Type or Title of MicroChart

iCheckBreadCrumb.!description:
Checks a specific breadcrumb link on the object page.

TODO this function will not be public yet: Its signature doesn't fit the framework.

parameters.sLink: type: string, description: The text property of the link to be tested. The links aggregation of the breadcrumb control is checked for the availability of the given text. If sLink is provided as an empty string, a check is executed to see whether the breadcrumb control exists and has an empty links aggregation. This is the case for the main object page, which does not show breadcrumb links. If sLink is not provided, a check is executed to ensure the breadcrumb control does not exist at all. This is the case for the flexible column layout showing multiple floorplans at the same time.

iCheckRelatedApps.!description: Checks the Related Apps action in the header toolbar.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the button

iCheckFilterField.!description: Checks a filter field. If vConditionValues is undefined, the current condition values are ignored.
iCheckFilterField.!type: fn(vFieldIdentifier: Object | sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, vConditionValues?: String | Object | Array, sOperator?: String, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.vConditionValues: type: string|object|Array, description: The expected value(s) of the filter field
parameters.sOperator: type: string, description: The expected operator
parameters.vFieldIdentifier: type: object|sap.fe.test.api.FilterFieldIdentifier, description: The identifier of the filter field
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the filter field

parameters.mDialogState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the dialog

iCheckDefineConditions.!description: Checks the Define conditions tab in a value help dialog. Please be aware that the tab control of the toolbar is checked.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the filter bar
type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the search field

iCheckRows.!description: Checks the rows of a table. If mRowValues is provided, only rows with the corresponding values are considered. If iNumberOfRows is provided, the number of rows are checked with respect to the provided mRowValues (if set) or in total. If iNumberOfRows is omitted, it checks for at least one matching row. If mState is provided, the row must be in the given state.
iCheckRows.!type: fn(mRowValues?: Object, iExpectedNumberOfRows?: Number, mState?: Object) -> Object

parameters.iExpectedNumberOfRows: type: number, description: The expected number of rows considering mRowValues and mRowState
parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the target row
type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the filter bar

iCheckSearchAndSelect.!description: Checks the Search and Select tab in a value help dialog. Please be aware that the tab control of the toolbar is checked.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the filter bar

iCheckSearchField.!description: Checks the search field in the filter bar. If the sSearchText parameter is undefined, the search text is not validated.

parameters.mState: type: object, description: Defines the expected state of the search field
parameters.sSearchText: type: string, description: The expected text in the search field
